ygData.subject: Re: Re: Re: SPOILER Cape of the Midnight Mist (was:RE: re: equipment)
ygData.msgSnippet: ... At level 32, one wrong move and you are dead in the Butler s Room. I m certain a level 32 druid with thistles up could probably knock out the butler fairly
ygData.messageBody:
> Cape, and they couldn't. Also, i know for a fact that the Butler can
> be soloed by a lvl 32 druid (considering that is how i got mine).
> According to the druid in question, it was an "easy" solo. (ie-easier
> than the ancient croc in uguk)

At level 32, one wrong move and you are dead in the Butler's Room.
I'm certain a level 32 druid with thistles up could probably knock
out the butler fairly quickly. But the Butler, like many other
inhabitants, drops a harm touch (~200 dmg). And if said druid
agro's the gargoyle that usually stands in there, or agros a
hallway roamer - KYAG. It's all in the pull vector, and object
angles that makes the room look really easy, until the unexpected
may occur. I know, I've been there many many times. Your level 32
druid will most likely finish the battle at 4o% mana and 5o% health.
I don't call that easy, I call it doable. =)

Even at L50 those two servant rooms can offer some trickiness
which could result in an attempt to gate or die. It's just
at L50 you have less of a chance to agro things that are several
levels green.

Then again, Harmony works in MM >8)

Harmonic, not as familiar with Mistmoore as Permafrost, but skilled.
